captions.text: ♪ (music) ♪
(engine noise)

We came here to Bosnia because we thought
this river would be a perfect place

to take a way of skating 
into a completely a new environment.
(engine noise)

We're trying to get up the hill,
get to the spot.

We got bunch of snow last night. 
So, we're about half way of this road,
and we will make it though.
♪ (music) ♪

The location that we are riding in,
is this really winding creek
that is in the bottom of this valley.

And this time of the year,
it's just completely blanketed in snow.

All you see is the river 
how it winds through there.
♪ (music) ♪

You know, the locals here
call it like the dragon's tail.
That's basically what it looks like.
♪ (music ends) ♪
(water slapping)
People say that a dragon-like snake has been chasing a horseman
through the valley of Studeni Potok and created the river with it’s tail.
♪ (music) ♪
More than two or three meters of snow can fall on Bjelašnica
and the people here have to live with that.
♪ (calm music) ♪
(water slapping)
♪ (heavy metal music) ♪
♪ (music ends) ♪

You know, we've been dealing 
with conditions like this

where it's been snowing on us
a lot on this trip, but we are

kind of focused on this one area
-- the river was not freezing.

And we found this really long line
that we could connect.

You know, going over up 
on the snow banks,

which is super fun,
just me carving on my wakeskate.
♪ (heavy metal music) ♪

I wanted different speeds for being
in the snow and then in the water.

I had to be going to be faster
in the water, so I didn't sink,

but then in the snow, going that speed
just felt really fast.

So, it was kind of a challenging.
But once we got the line figured out,
it was really fun to just session it.
♪ (heavy metal music) ♪

We ultimately just want to inspire people
to think outside of the box,

and maybe they'd take a sport
that you'd only see in the summer time
into the winter, into the snow.

We really had fun riding
in these conditions
and being here in Bosnia.

title: Winter wakeskate wonderland w/ Brian Grubb

comments.author: Laszlo Kruppa

comments.text:
In his constant pursuit of new challenges, wakeskating pioneer Brian Grubb 
paid a visit to Bosnia and Herzegovina and headed for Olympic mountain 
Bjelasnica, 25 kilometer from Sarajevo. His vision was to take wakeskating 
completely out of the summer environment and put it in winter conditions.

Find out more: 
http://www.redbull.com/en/adventure/stories/1331706492068/shredding-snow-like-you-ve-never-seen-before

#bosniaandherzegovina #ViaDinarica #winterwonderland  ﻿
comments.author: Bosnia&Herzegovina You Know Nothing About

comments.author: Igor K.

comments.text:
Great stuff and I am very pleased that you guy's have had such a good time 
in our mountains, but since Studen potok is very nice place with its wild 
nature it would be desirable to take all your ramp's and pillar's away when 
you have finished your exercise and not just leave it behind! I thought you 
guy's appreciate and protect wild nature as it is, must say that I am 
pretty disappointed to see that is not the case.﻿

comments.text:
Translation of what an older Bosnian man said: "story goes that dragon was 
chasing horseman along the Studeni potok (Winter creek) and with its tail 
created what is today an actual creek. Here in Bjelasnica it can snow over 
2 meters, maybe up to 3 meters of snow, but people living here withstand 
these winter conditions."﻿
